hints.content:
We will add the vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{a}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0bab626b444d8150bd7a6e321a20374c533940c9.png)

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{b}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{a}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+\vec{b}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{b}$, meaning $(8,3)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f3fd0887b28f0ad76dee409ce12990b83bd6c100.png)

The correct position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+\vec{b}$ is $(8,3)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1b0fe7672102e45092553b1f47bb6201be0340fe.png)

question.content:
Vectors $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$ are drawn in the interactive graph below.  
  
**Click to graph the terminal point of the vector obtained by adding $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$, whose initial point is the origin.**  
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content:
We will add the vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{a}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{b}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{a}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+\vec{b}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{b}$, meaning $(2,-4)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/39c052cd0aa946048b4515d44d27a6305182ca35.png)

The correct position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+\vec{b}$ is $(2,-4)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2722783edce948ee6e73a81c4b6497c129e0d40c.png)

hints.content:
We will add the vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{a}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8dad634d6dc8adc899403b516f8bb630cfce3619.png)

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{b}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{a}$.

question.content:
Vectors $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$ are drawn in the interactive graph below.  
  
**Click to graph the terminal point of the vector obtained by adding $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$, whose initial point is the origin.**  
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content:
Subtracting $\vec{a}$ from $\vec{b}$ is the same as adding $\vec{b}$ and $\vec{-a}$, where $\vec{-a}$ is a vector in the opposite direction of $\vec{a}$ and with the same length. We will add these vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{b}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ec620f96ef54f721c91b0337826fc94722c5a013.png)

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{-a}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{b}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{b}+(\vec{-a})=\vec{b}-\vec{a}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{-a}$, meaning $(9,2)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/26ff1a120b8e3943a4ab4167b48e76d4956af8da.png)

The correct position of the terminal point of $\vec{b}-\vec{a}$ is $(9,2)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a2010aef91a2e1a412850be21d7e559b1d6e0f40.png)

question.content:
Vectors $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{b}$ are drawn in the interactive graph below.  
  
**Click to graph the terminal point of the vector obtained by subtracting $\vec{a}$ from $\vec{b}$, whose initial point is the origin.**  
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content:
Subtracting $\vec{b}$ from $\vec{a}$ is the same as adding $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{-b}$, where $\vec{-b}$ is a vector in the opposite direction of $\vec{b}$ and with the same length. We will add these vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{a}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/e1882dbbf7932a45626db9bcc18ed589930a15f0.png)

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{-b}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{a}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+(\vec{-b})=\vec{a}-\vec{b}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{-b}$, meaning $(-6,0)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b3314bff224820c252f8fcf09eb22b626137b8dd.png)

The correct position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}-\vec{b}$ is $(-6,0)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/94e9f58212bd90cd084635103c6e58f8a3f70129.png)

hints.content:
Subtracting $\vec{b}$ from $\vec{a}$ is the same as adding $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{-b}$, where $\vec{-b}$ is a vector in the opposite direction of $\vec{b}$ and with the same length. We will add these vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{a}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/87334c1fb08a2114243d27960962bf44a8fc4b74.png)

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{-b}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{a}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}+(\vec{-b})=\vec{a}-\vec{b}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{-b}$, meaning $(-1,5)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a82b0f80784fe99ac9eb36b2d158481a546977ee.png)

The correct position of the terminal point of $\vec{a}-\vec{b}$ is $(-1,5)$.  
  
$\qquad$![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/b77006afcb7f319f5a51607d26b1cdf67df9d0ec.png)

hints.content:
Subtracting $\vec{a}$ from $\vec{b}$ is the same as adding $\vec{b}$ and $\vec{-a}$, where $\vec{-a}$ is a vector in the opposite direction of $\vec{a}$ and with the same length. We will add these vectors by connecting them end to end.  
  
Our first vector is $\vec{b}$. Its initial point should be placed where the initial point of the sum should be, meaning the origin.

Next, we place the initial point of $\vec{-a}$ on the terminal point of $\vec{b}$.  
  
Now we can see that the position of the terminal point of $\vec{b}+(\vec{-a})=\vec{b}-\vec{a}$ is the position of the terminal point of $\vec{-a}$, meaning $(-2,7)$.
